messages.title: Our Economy Can't Afford More Uncertainty with a Hung Parliament.
messages.content: Labour can't win a majority. But if you don't vote, Jeremy Corbyn could still become Prime Minister. Propped up by smaller parties like Nicola Sturgeon's SNP. That means more uncertainty for our economy. With no end to the Brexit arguments. And another Scottish independence referendum. That's not all. Corbyn's plans for our economy would undo the progress of the last few years. The head of the CBI, a business group, said that Corbyn's plans would 'crack the foundations of our economy'. With massive taxes on businesses - which will stop investment and cost jobs. And with £1.2 trillion of extra spending - which will send our public finances back into chaos. Don't let Labour take us back to square one. Vote Conservative and secure the majority government this country needs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Vote Conservative to avoid uncertainty and secure a majority government to stabilize the economy.

mentions.tacticalSituation: If you don't vote, Jeremy Corbyn could still become Prime Minister.

issues.brexitEurope: More delay and uncertainty on Brexit just means more damage to the economy.

issues.labourEmployment: Cited statements: 'Brexit uncertainty drives up job losses and holds back the economy.'

endorsements.endorsement: Confederation of British Industry chief warns that more indecision in parliament will lead to less investment. Brexit uncertainty drives up job losses and holds back economy.
Bank of England chief says Boris Johnson's Brexit deal is good for the UK. That means good for jobs.
